talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>That elf called Arc... Can he be trusted?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
Meow…?
(Fargeau looks at you with his nose buried in the catnip.)
<html>$[Awakening] Mysterious Guide$</html>

$Arc$
It’s an honor to meet you.

$Arc$
Here, this way.

$Arc$
It will be safe here.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Right. I still don't have an idea what kind of person he is.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
Hmm... As I mentioned before, I can vouch for him.
But I guess you want more details than that, right {user_nick}?

$Merchant Fargeau$
Then I'll give you more information about the one known as Arc.
By right, I would ask for something in return, but I received something in advance so...
(Fargeau tucks the catnip safely in his pocket.)

$Merchant Fargeau$
Arc has been in Merca's Heart for a long time.
He was one of the elves who managed the Distorted Zone more than 200 years ago.

$Merchant Fargeau$
I don't know what happened but one day Arc suddenly left the other elves and joined the Anti-Goddess Faction.
It is an exceptional case for an elf who is not even a resident of Merca to join the Anti-Goddess Faction. Elves never disobey the goddess.

$Merchant Fargeau$
Of course.
They never leave the area they are assigned, since they see it as their fate determined by the Goddess.
There are rare cases that make them leave, like receiving special missions from the Goddess.

$Merchant Fargeau$
For example, escorting the next Oracle-to-be to the Empire.
For such missions, the elves will leave their assigned area to embark on a journey to the Empire as holy warriors.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>And yet you think he can be trusted?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
That's right. Elves usually act like they have little emotion.
It's because they are puppets who only follow the will of the Goddess.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(He said he was a fallen elf...)</html>
<html>Is a fallen elf different from other elves?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
Right! That's why Arc seems unique and special to me.
He seems more like a human than an elf. What could have made him like that, I wonder...

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Then why do you think he can be trusted?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
That's not all. Fallen elves are not free from the Goddesses' influence.
Although they are treated badly because of their weak power and short lifespan, they feel the same way about the Goddess as the other elves.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What? You believe he is simply like a human?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
That's just it! Think about it, {user_nick}.
A human-like figure was born in a place where it was considered an honor to be a puppet of the Goddess.

$Merchant Fargeau$
Meow, of course that's not enough. The most important thing is trust.
Arc is a very reliable client. He's never broken a deal, and never been late.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Maybe it's a lie. He could be a spy...</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
It's not easy to find a trusted partner in Mistland.
Besides, I've never heard of any harm done to the Anti-Goddess Faction because of Arc.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Then, could there be a special reason for all this?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
Meow… It could be.
But everyone knows what elves are like, so why would they spy? I don't think anyone would believe them.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>… Okay. I think I'll have to meet him again.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Fargeau$
Probably? I think it was pretty recently that he started talking about the Anti-Goddess Faction…
Wouldn't something have happened around at that time?

$Merchant Fargeau$Is that so? If you want to meet him, Arc
is waiting at Cradle of the Abandoned.
It's a dangerous place, so please be careful.

$Arc$
{user_nick}! There you are!
(The bird on his staff chirps softly.)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>A fallen elf... Was it that important...?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc${action:Talk}
I was worried you might not come.
Other people in Mistland don't trust fallen elves like me... So I was really worried...

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Yes. All elves are born from fruits of the Tree of Life.</html>
<html>I don't know the details but I heard that's the case.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
Oh? Ah… Right, you are from Lagendia, so you might not be aware.
(Arc hesitates for a moment, then resumes speaking.)
{user_nick}, are the elves of Lagendia also born from the Tree of Life?

$Arc$
Just like Mistland. That would make it easier for you to understand.
I don't know about the Tree of Life in Lagendia, but for Mistland, there are rare cases of rotten and distorted fruits being borne.

$Arc$
Such fruits normally fall and rot before they hatch, but some elves are born from the fruits that have fallen.
Elves born from the rotten fruit that fell to the ground are called fallen elves in Mistland.

$Arc$
Fallen elves are disabled from the moment they are born. In Mistland, deformities are a threat to life and a sin in itself.
That's why fallen elves normally can't live for more than 20 years or are chased away and neglected until they die because they are considered useless.

$Arc$
But it's not like the other creatures won't eventually suffer the same fate.
All the lives in Mistland will sooner or later be abandoned by Goddess Vestinel.

$Arc$
Even Childs and those who are stronger than Childs will not escape this fate. The only difference is when they are discarded.

$Arc$
The only one who can save us from the cruel Goddess is you, {user_nick}, the savior from Lagendia.
So please give me the chance to help you.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I appreciate that, but in fact, that alone doesn't make sense.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
I will tell you how you can become stronger, and I'll also give all the information I have about the Goddess Faction. I am doing this for you and the Anti-Goddess Faction, {user_nick}...

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I want to know why you decided to help me.</html>
<html>May I ask why you decided to betray your kind and the Goddess?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
... Come again?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>If it's too hard to talk about, you don't have to say anything!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
That…

$Arc$
No. Actually…
(Arc opens his mouth with an indescribable look on his face...)

$Arc${sound:npc_Ark_4786_qu_01.ogg}
It would be my pleasure.
No one was ever interested in my story.

$Arc$
Camellia…
Have you heard the name Camellia here in Mistland?

$Arc$
That's what I thought... She's an elf who died 300 years ago.
It was none other than Goddess Vestinel who killed her...

$Arc$
Camellia was a fallen elf like me. We grew on the same branch and were born on the same day.
I had a distorted eye and she had shorter ears and hearing problems as a result. We treated it as fate that we were born on the same day and we relied on each other as we survived.

$Arc$
We thought we might die together some day. But luckily we managed to live on and in our 50th year, a dimension traveler appeared before us.

$Arc${action:No}
That's all he told us so I don't know anything else about him.
He called us "children with Lagendia's good will" and said that we were born as fallen elves because Mistland wanted to destroy elements from Lagendia. And he gave something to us.

$Arc${action:Talk}
That's right, the thing that you and I are about to go and find, {user_nick}… A meteorite fragment that can Awaken the power inside you.
The dimension traveler called it Harmonium.

$Arc$
With Harmonium's power, we were able to live a longer life than the other fallen fruit elves. But I still have a scar on my eye and Camellia's ears remained short.And Camelia also gained a surprising amount of power.

$Arc$
Not only her archery skills, but also her strength and magic became more powerful than any other elf.
Thanks to that, she earned the praise of the other elves and eventually caught the attention of Goddess Vestinel too.

$Arc$
… Hang on. Something's not right...

$Arc$
I don't believe this place is safe anymore.
I'm sorry for making things difficult for you, but let's meet again in Merca's Heart.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It all began with Camellia being noticed by the Goddess.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
Sorry to have made you move locations so suddenly. I couldn't help it, as it was a matter of safety.
Then... Allow me to continue my story.

$Arc$
Where was I...? Oh yes. By the time I was finally accepted to be one of the elves who managed the Distorted Zone, Camellia had achieved great things. She soon left me, saying, "I am going to become a priestess," and gave me her Harmonium.

$Arc$
Yes, we elves typically stay and work in the place we are assigned by the Goddess for the rest of their lives. However, you can also become a holy warrior who escorts Oracle candidates, or, by decree of the Goddess, a priestess. Those who become the latter are allowed to enter the Holy Edart Empire.

$Arc$
Camellia was a strong elf and in Mistland, where the strong reign over the weak, such people have the right to make such choices. I didn't blame her because I thought she chose the path of devoting her life to the Goddess.

$Arc$
Soon, I heard rumors that she had become a priestess.
But after several decades, I found out, again from rumors, that she had actually died.

$Arc$
… Not long ago, I was given the task of escorting an Oracle candidate as a holy warrior. The candidate's name was Pitya. Much to my surprise, she bore an amazing resemblance to Camellia. I was in anguish the entire time…

$Arc$
After the mission, I was able to stay outside the Empire for some time, so I searched for news about Camelia. Even if a priestess died a long time ago, records remain.

$Arc$
For a long time, I thought she died honorably while serving Goddess Vestinel. But that wasn't the case. The price she paid for devoting her life to the Goddess was... a meaningless and horrible death.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>A test subject? What kind of tests were they doing?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
She…
Was killed after becoming a test subject of the Empire.

$Arc$
That's right. It was an experiment to find a more powerful Oracle candidate.
300 years ago... The Goddess wanted to know if there was a body that was more powerful than her previous vessels.

$Arc$
So the goddess ordered Childs and elves to bring women to her.
Some were kidnapped and some were lured by rumors that made them come to the Empire.

$Arc$
She possessed the bodies of the women one by one and if the bodies were not good enough for her, she ruthlessly killed them. So many lives were sacrificed.
Among them, there were little girls and old women, and even Childs too.

$Arc$
… We were brainwashed that those who are strong can win the favor of the Goddess.
However, the Goddess treated the strong ones as toys who could be sacrificed at her whim.
Lives in Mistland were just tools for her to use as she pleased...

$Arc${action:Sad}{sound:npc_Ark_4786_qu_02.ogg}
I didn't know anything about the cruelty and unfairness of this world that time.
I only realized it when a girl was taken right before my eyes and I found out that Camellia died...

$Arc${sound:npc_Ark_4786_qu_03.ogg}
… That is why I devoted myself to the Anti-Goddess Faction.
I want this world to fall. I want to end the world of the Goddess who mercilessly killed Camellia.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(I'm only doing this for my own reasons...)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc${action:Talk}
And for people like me who have been abandoned by the Goddess, you are the only one who can make that wish come true. You are our only hope, {user_nick} .

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I'm sorry for making you tell such a horrible story.</html>
<html>I trust you and I will help you.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
(Arc smiles quietly and opens his mouth again.)
Have I told you everything you want to know?

$Arc${sound:npc_Ark_4783_qu_01.ogg}
(Arc bows politely.)
Thank you for giving me your trust... Now I can finally make my wish come true.

$Arc$
Then, now… Allow me to explain about the Harmonium you will use, {user_nick}.

$Arc$
I wish we could use my Harmonium right away but the energy in these fragments have already been drained.
I guess both Camellia and I have used up the power inside them.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Is it all right for it to be in a Child's territory?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
I've been searching for information through my contacts and learned that a few Childs have jewels that seem to be Harmonium.
I also learned that the one in Tryan's Territory is real Harmonium.

$Arc${action:No}
I don't know why but the power of Harmonium cannot be used by Mistlanders.
That means Childs cannot use Harmonium. To them, Harmonium is just a sparkling jewel, nothing more than that. As a result, Tryan has also been left alone for a long time.

$Arc$
{user_nick}, please enter Tryan's Territory first and attract the guards' attention.
Then I'll follow behind and sneak out the Harmonium. We'll meet each other again at the end of Tryan's Territory.

$Arc$
(Arc's eyes open wide with surprise, but he soon smiles faintly.)
Are you... concerned about me?

$Arc$
I'm good at hiding myself. It would be hard for me to take the Harmonium alone, but I can manage with your help, {user_nick}.
If I replace Tryan's Harmonium with the one in my pendant, they won't even realize we took it.

$Arc$
Thank you. I'll make sure to bring the Harmonium safely.
Please be careful too, {user_nick}.

$Arc$
If you're ready, please go to Tryan's Territory.
I'll see you again at the end of Tryan's Territory.

$Arc$
This way, {user_nick}.

$Arc$
(Arc passes you a shining rock wrapped in cloth.)
This is the Harmonium. Please take it.

$Arc$
I'll stay behind and see if we've left any traces of our presence.
Please escape from here first, {user_nick}.

$Arc$
Since I'm here, there's something I'd like to settle, so I can't go back with you.
Please don't worry about me, {user_nick}.

$ArC${action:No}
You don't have to look for me anymore.
Please show the Harmonium to Fargeau. He'll know how to use it.

$Arc${sound:npc_Ark_4787_qu_01.ogg}
(Arc smiles faintly.) There will be a day when we meet again.
I still have things left to do. I'm sure our paths will cross again.

$Arc$
There is something that the dimension traveler who saved me a long time ago told me.
He said elves in Lagendia have something called Telesia.
They are born with a destiny and they live to explore it.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It's different. Telesia doesn't heed a person's commands.</html>
<html>It's hard to say why, but I think it's different.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$To the elves in Lagendia, everything they do is following their Telesia, so I heard they don't go against the flow.
Do you think it's different from following the Goddess's orders? Is it different from the fate of Mistland
's elves?

$Arc$
(After explaining to Arc more about Telesia, his eyes widen with curiosity.)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I'm still searching for my own Telesia.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Arc$
... Then {user_nick}, you must have a Telesia too.
May I know what it is?

$Arc${action:Sad}
I see. It's not something fixed from the day you are born, so you can continue to explore and learn about your Telesia as you live on.
So you have the chance to question whether the path you're taking is your true Telesia too...
(Arc mumbles to himself.)

$Arc$
{user_nick}, after meeting you…
(Arc hesitates.)

$Arc$
… I had a thought that...
Maybe a lowly fallen elf like me has a Telesia too.

$Arc$
Fate in Mistland is determined by the strength we have at birth, and we are destined to obey that unfair Goddess.
But I have been thinking that maybe my destiny... my Telesia is rejecting such a life and helping you, {user_nick}.

$Arc$
So I'll continue to help you and the Anti-Goddess Faction, {user_nick}.
I'll do whatever I can to make Mistland fall and bring peace from the world of the good Goddess.

$Arc${action:Talk}{sound:npc_Ark_4787_qu_02.ogg}
I hope you don't give up and fulfill our hopes and your dreams, {user_nick}.
Please free Mistland and save the abandoned children... and be the hero of a beautiful world.

$Arc$
(Arc bows low.)
I'll bid farewell here.

$Arc$
Fargeau will teach you how to use the Harmonium.
Please take care until we meet again.

$Merchant Fargeau$
(Fargeau is grooming his fur with his wares on the ground.)

$Merchant Fargeau$
Oh, you're back, {user_nick}!
<html>$Quest Complete$</html>

$Merchant Fargeau$
You're here just at the right time.
I was about to go to another area after resting here for a while.

journal.title: A Question of Trust
journal.contents:
You better ask Fargeau if this elf known as Arc is trustworthy or not. If he is willing to introduce you, he must know what kind of an elf he is.

Merca's Heart - Merchant Fargeau
journal.destination: Talk to Merchant Fargeau at Merca's Heart

journal.title: In the Cradle of the Abandoned
journal.contents:
The elves of Mistland are well-known to be puppets of the Goddess. And yet there is one who claims to be a member of the Anti-Goddess Faction. You might as well hear him out.Arc is waiting in the Cradle of the Abandoned. Go meet with him.
※You have to clear the stage before you can carry out this quest.

Merca's Heart (Aorta Gateway) - Cradle of the Abandoned
journal.destination: Talk to Arc at Cradle of the Abandoned
journal.todo_msg: Clear Cradle of the Abandoned and talk to Arc

journal.title: Story of the Abandoned
journal.contents:
After discussing the betrayal of the Goddess and his people who were once the purpose of his entire existence, Arc began to feel uneasy and suggested that you move to another location to continue the discussion. Return to Merca's Heart and speak with him again.

Merca's Heart - Arc
journal.destination: Talk to Arc in Merca's Heart
journal.todo_msg: Talk to Arc in Merca's Heart.

journal.title: Find Harmonium
journal.contents:
Arc told you about the power of Harmonium, the meterorite fragment he received from a dimension traveler. He says that this meteorite fragment that saved his own life after becoming a fallen elf can grant you the power of Awakening. You agreed to help Arc get the Harmonium stored in Tryan's Territory. Clear Tryan's Territory and meet up with Arc.

Merca's Heart (Blue Sand Trade Route) - Tryan's Territory
journal.destination: Talk to Arc at Tryan's Territory
journal.todo_msg: Talk to Arc at Tryan's Territory.

journal.title: The Power of Harmonium
journal.contents:
At last, you found the Harmonium. Arc said Fargeau will teach you how to use the Harmonium. Talk to Fargeau.

Merca's Heart - Merchant Fargeau
journal.destination: Talk to Merchant Fargeau at Merca's Heart
journal.todo_msg: Talk to Merchant Fargeau at Merca's Heart.
